document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic position of Pontonides sympathes De Ridder & Holthuis and species of the genus Ve l e r o n i a Holthuis (Decapoda, Palaemonidae, Pontoniinae) with the description of a new genus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic position of Pontonides sympathes De Ridder & Holthuis and species of the genus Ve l e r o n i a Holthuis (Decapoda, Palaemonidae, Pontoniinae) with the description of a new genus

heading.emphasis:
Key to the genera
Pontonides , Ve
le ro n i a and
Pseudoveleronia
gen. nov.

paragraph.keyLead:
1 . Orbits complete and closed. Basal segment of antenna with distolateral and lateral projections. Scaphocerite without distolateral tooth. Fingers of pereiopod I shovel-like, without stout setae along distal margin of cutting edges. Chelipeds of pereiopods II similar in shape, with smooth stout compressed palm, which is about twice longer than wide and twice longer than fingers. Merus of pereiopod III with large distoventral protuberance. Exopod of uropods with distolateral margin rounded, without fixed distolateral tooth and movable spine ................................................................
Pseudoveleronia laevifrons
comb. nov.

- Orbits never closed. Basal segment of antenna normal, without lateral projection. Scaphocerite with distinct distolateral tooth. Fingers of pereiopod I simple, with stout setae along distal margin of cutting edges. Chelipeds of pereiopods II dissimilar; major chela with long curved palm, about 4 times as long as wide, covered with small teeth or tubercles; fingers of chelipeds less than ¼ palm length. Merus of pereiopod III normal, without large distoventral protuberance. Distolateral margin of exopod of uropod with fixed tooth, without movable spine ............................................................................................................ 2

2 . Basal segments of maxilliped I–III bearing fusiform setae. Maxilla with reduced endites. Distolateral margin of exopod of uropods with tooth separated from the margin. Minor chela of pereiopod II dissimilar in males and females; fingers of minor chela in males are long, thin and straight, similar to palmar length while fingers are shorter and stouter in females. Basal part of appendix masculina bearing single plumose setae .......................................................................
Pontonides
spp. (for a key to species, see
Marin 2007
)

3 . Carapace not gibbous, with distal supraorbital margin smooth. Exopod of maxilliped I well-developed ...... .....................................................................................................................................
Veleronia sympathes

- Carapace gibbous, with distal supraorbital margin bearing small triangular teeth. Exopod of maxilliped I rudimentary................................................................................................................
Veleronia serratifrons
